triggers.text: Syrskyi stated that Russian forces breached Ukrainian engineering barriers only in a few places near Pokrovsk, and that the situation remains under control. He confirmed contingency plans 'B' and 'C' for all scenarios.
triggers.why_it_matters: Demonstrates layered contingency planning and disciplined command structure under stress, reinforcing Ukraine’s defensive coherence and adaptability.
triggers.bf_note: + Bayesian Factor for control resilience and operational foresight.

triggers.text: Ukrainians: 'No electricity, no connection, no heat — but we have NO RUSSIANS!'
triggers.why_it_matters: Reflects extraordinary civilian morale. Signals that Russian strategic terror campaigns—energy blackouts, infrastructure strikes—continue to fail in breaking Ukrainian will to resist. Psychological resilience remains a decisive asymmetric advantage.
triggers.bf_note: + BF for Ukrainian civil resilience and strategic endurance

triggers.text: Ukraine peace talks suspended as Russia regains limited battlefield initiative and Western aid falters; Europe rearming while U.S. pivots toward Indo-Pacific.
triggers.why_it_matters: Signals an asymmetric phase shift. Ukraine faces near-term supply and diplomatic pressure, but Western rearmament indicates long-term containment posture. Short-term instability, medium-term resilience.
triggers.bf_note: ↓ BF to 0.85 for short-term support degradation; re-evaluate after 30 days or next NATO/Trump policy inflection.
